snippet: Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens reportedly took shelter in a hot, smoke-filled room and lost consciousness there during the attack on the diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya.
abstract: Remains of United States Ambassador to Libya J Christopher Stevens and three other Americans return to the US; witnesses recall the chaos during the deadly riot at the diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libay, saying Stevens took shelter in a hot, smoke-filled room before losing consciousness.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER, DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and SULIMAN ALI ZWAY
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo and Suliman Ali Zway from Benghazi, Libya. Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens reportedly took shelter in a hot, smoke-filled room and lost consciousness there during the attack on the diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya.

headline.seo: Ambassador’s Body Back in U.S.; Libya Guards Recount Riot
headline.main: Diplomats’ Bodies Return to U.S., and Libyan Guards Recount Deadly Riot
headline.print_headline: Diplomats’ Bodies Return to U.S., and Libyan Guards Recount Deadly Riot
